page.title: 11HUMBIE SCHOOL IN THE PAST.
page.content: OUR DINNER LADY CAME TO THIS SCHOOL TWENTY YEARS AGO.SHE GOT UP AT SEVEN THIRTY TO GET THE BUS AT EIGHT O'CLOCK.SHE WALKED WHEN IT WAS A NICE DAY.AT BREAK SHE PLAYED HOPSCOTCH, ROUNDERS OR SKIPPING.HER FAVOURITE SUBJECTS WERE MATHS AND HISTORY BUT SHE DIDN'T LIKE SPELLING.MOST SCHOOLS THEN USED A TIME TABLE.SHE GOT READING SPELLING OR SUMS FOR HOMEWORK.SCHOOL LUNCHES WERE SERVED AND PACKED LUNCHES EATEN OUTSIDE.THERE WERE TWO TEACHERS IN THE SCHOOL AND THEY WERE VERY STRICT.THE SCHOOL WAS LIT BY ELECTRIC BULBS.THERE WERE ABOUT THIRTY SEVEN PUPILS WHICH IS QUITE A LOT COMPARED TO NOW.AT THAT TIME MOST CHILDREN WOULD USE PAPER BUT SOME USED SLATES. THE CHILDREN WOULD SIT IN ROWS IN FRONT OF THE TEACHER.
